data.title: RM of Vanscoy
data.text:
The RM of Vanscoy is pleased to announce it has chosen the Voyent Alert! service to keep you informed during times of crisis and for day-to-day notices. Register now to receive important notifications that matter to you. The service is free, easy to use and totally anonymous.

Credit card payments can be made on our website only through a third-party service provider called OptionPay. This service uses a tiered fee schedule, and the fees are collected on behalf of OptionPay. The fee will be calculated automatically and applied to your payment total.

Please note: When using Credit Card options it may take 3-5 business days for payment to be processed. If the payment is not received in our office prior to the due date because of this reason, we will not waive any penalties that have been applied, nor honour any discounts that were missed.

If you are hauling within the RM of Vanscoy you may need an overweight permit. We have one heavy haul road, Range Road 3072 from Highway 14 - Highway 7. We have two Primary Weight Roads portion of Range Road 3081 as identified as "Prairie Lane Road" North Bound from Highway #7, and as identified as "Young Road" South Bound from Highway #14, located North from Highway #7 West of Sections 02, 11, 14, 23, 26, 35-35-08 W3, West of Sections 02, 11, 14, 23, 26-36-08 W3 to Highway #14 and portion of Range Road 3084 known as "Lynne Road" located North from Highway No. 14 West of Section 32-36-08 W3 to the RM of Corman Park No. 344 Boundary.

All other roads within the RM are either secondary or 10 tonne rated. If your load is overweight, please contact Roadata services at 1-844-232-7275 or www.roadata.com. They are open Monday - Sunday 6:00 am to 8:00 pm with after-hours available upon request.

The RM of Vanscoy has a rich history dating back to before 1935 when it was known as the Rural Municipality of Loganton. Today, our municipality is home to a variety of vibrant communities, including Vanscoy, Delisle, Asquith, Pike Lake Provincial Park, and four hamlets. We are proud to be the home of Agrium, an international potash mine that contributes to the local economy. With a population of 2,714, we are a tight-knit community that values inclusivity and welcomes newcomers with open arms.
